name: AzureDevTestLabsCreateVM
description: Create an Azure DevTest Labs VM
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure RM Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to configure before running.

inputs.name: LabId
inputs.label: Lab Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of an existing lab in which the lab VM will be created. This is a pick list generated as a result of selecting an **Azure RM Subscription**.

inputs.name: TemplateName
inputs.label: Template Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the ARM template. You can generate the ARM template from the **View ARM template** section when creating a Lab VM. Select the ARM template by browsing to the file that you have saved in your VSTS source control. It can be either a relative path in a build output or a relative path inside an artifacts package.

inputs.name: TemplateParameters
inputs.label: Template Parameters
inputs.defaultValue: -newVMName '$(<Enter VM Name>)' -userName '$(<Enter User Name>)' -password (ConvertTo-SecureString -String '$(<Enter User Password>)' -AsPlainText -Force)
inputs.helpMarkDown: ARM template parameters to use. You can use any variable such as `$(Build.BuildNumber)` or `$(Release.ReleaseName)` when in a build or a release, respectively, for the `newVMName`. Similarly, you can create variables such as `User.Name` and `User.Password`, where the latter is marked as a _secret_.

inputs.name: OutputResourceId
inputs.label: Lab VM ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Variable to capture the created lab VM ID. Default is `labVMId`. The variable can be referred as `$(labVMId)` in subsequent tasks. You can use a name other than the default.

inputs.name: FailOnArtifactError
inputs.label: Fail on artifact error
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the task if any artifact fails to apply successfully.

inputs.name: RetryOnFailure
inputs.label: Retry the deployment following any failure
inputs.helpMarkDown: Retry the deployment when failing to create the lab VM or if any artifact fails to apply successfully.

inputs.name: RetryCount
inputs.label: Number of times to retry the deployment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of times to retry the deployment when an error occurs, either while creating the lab VM or if any artifact fails to apply successfully.

inputs.name: DeleteFailedLabVMBeforeRetry
inputs.label: Delete the failed lab VM before retrying
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the failed lab VM before retrying to create a new lab VM.

inputs.name: DeleteFailedDeploymentBeforeRetry
inputs.label: Delete the failed deployment before retrying
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the failed deployment before retrying to create the lab VM.

inputs.name: AppendRetryNumberToVMName
inputs.label: Append the retry iteration number to the VM name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Append the retry iteration number to the lab VM name before retrying (i.e. newVMName-1). Note that this may cause your lab VM name to be longer than allowed.

inputs.name: WaitMinutesForApplyArtifacts
inputs.label: Number of minutes to wait in case the apply artifacts operation is still running
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of minutes to wait for the apply artifacts operation to complete after the deployment has indicated completion.
